edu.cuny.ai.learning
Class EpsilonGreedyActionChoosingPolicy

java.lang.Object
  edu.cuny.ai.learning.ActionChoosingPolicy
      edu.cuny.ai.learning.EpsilonGreedyActionChoosingPolicy
All Implemented Interfaces:
LearningPolicy, Parameterizable, Prototypeable, Resetable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class EpsilonGreedyActionChoosingPolicy
extends ActionChoosingPolicy
implements Parameterizable

A policy used by StimuliResponseLearner to update the expected returns of multiple discrete actions based on the epsilon-greedy method in Section 2.2, Sutton and Barto's RL book

epsilon is constant when alpha is 1, or reducing down to minepsilon when alpha is less than 1.

Parameters

base.epsilon
double in (0,1) (0.1 by default)		 (the probability that the actions except the best action are randomly chosen)
base.minepsilon
double >= 0 (0 by default)		 (the minimum value for epsilon)
base.alpha
double in (0,1] (1 by default)		 (the reducing rate of epsilon over time)

Default Base

epsilon_greedy_action_choosing

Version:
$Revision: 1.7 $
Author:
Jinzhong Niu
